snippet: Martin Scorsese’s “The Wolf of Wall Street,” starring Leonardo DiCaprio, was completed last week and hurriedly scheduled for movie industry screenings.
abstract: Martin Scorsese’s two-hour, 59-minute film The Wolf of Wall Street, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, is completed just in time and hurriedly scheduled for movie industry screenings, making it last of Oscar season movies to surface; daring to be both late and long is rare brinkmanship in Hollywood that has become more accustomed to corporate discipline.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES

lead_paragraph: Martin Scorsese’s “The Wolf of Wall Street,” starring Leonardo DiCaprio, was completed last week and hurriedly scheduled for movie industry screenings.

headline.main: A Scorsese Film Gets In Under the Oscar Wire
headline.print_headline: A Scorsese Film Gets In Under the Oscar Wire
